Key Match Events: Edwin Diaz blew a crucial save in the eighth inning, allowing a game-winning grand slam to Corbin Carroll after walking the first two batters he faced.
Corbin Carroll hit a go-ahead grand slam in the eighth inning, securing the win for the Diamondbacks.
Post-Match Reflections: Edwin Diaz expressed frustration over the loss, stating, 'We had it. We have got to keep playing baseball and at the end of the season we’ll see where we are.'
Manager Carlos Mendoza noted he wasn't concerned about Diaz's performance, though Diaz admitted he didn't get the job done.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Luis Severino was removed after 4 ²/₃ innings, allowing four earned runs on eight hits with nine strikeouts and one walk.
Severino was injured by a line drive off his right foot but stayed in the game, though his performance was affected.
